reviewDescription: The Amazon Basics 256 GB Flash Drive is a reliable and cost-effective choice for users seeking a good balance between capacity and performance. It excels in basic tasks and is a great option for everyday data storage needs. While it may not offer the highest speeds or most rugged design, its practicality and value make it a solid choice for those who prioritize functionality and affordability.

Purchased 2 of these for my car stereo. The expensive, top of the line brands seem to work great for a few minutes, then stop unexpectedly while the stereo displays, "unsupported." I thought maybe it's bcuz my car is 13 years old and the top of the line, fastest flash drives may actually be too fast for the mp3 player to handle. So far it appears I was correct.These Amazon branded flash drives haven't stopped once, even while constantly playing for hours on long drives. All the tracks are high bit rate 278-320kbps mp3 as well. So far, so good. 👍Write speeds are REALLY slow. It took two entire days to transfer 100GB of music onto these, while the exact same data only took two hours with new Samsung drives. 🐢 I've had numerous other brands fail during long write sessions in the past, so this was very positive as well.Read speeds are in that Goldilocks zone where they're not too fast and not too slow for my needs.They're slow, but reliable. For the price, I can't be happier.
good!

Like nearly all flash drives with retractable connectors, this one closes about half the time it is shoved in the USB connector.  Really, can't someone design a reasonable latch?  Holding on to it during insertion should not be necessary. I've had worse, especially the drives that have a regular USB connector on one end and a mini on the other.  Those get to collapse two ways.  The memory works and generally writes around 28 MB/sec.  I have filled the whole drive in a single session so it doesn't overheat.

reviewDescription: You’ll have to double check it’s all the way in the USB Port or all the way out the shell:/

reviewTitle: Write speed very dissapointing, read speed is very good
reviewDescription: This drive writes at about the same speed as my cheap ones. I noticed that the 1st time I loaded a couple of hundred meg into it, so I set up a little test. My computer has a USB 3.2 port through which I commonly read and/or write multi-gig files, usually to or from the fast SD cards that I use in my cameras, usually at several hundred+ meg/sec. It will go up to close to a thousand meg when writing to my SSD backup drives. BTW: The destination and source folder in the test is on a 2 T M.2 NVME card.Point of all that being that any bottlenecks in the system are far above the ratings on the Amazon Basics flash drive.I did a full format on the flash drive and loaded a few folders of images averaging a couple to a few gig. Plugged directly into the port with no cord, every one of the files wrote onto the Amazon card at a speed of slightly less than 10 meg average, peaking at no greater than 24 meg but dropping immediately. I did a screen grab of a sample and attached it above.I'm an engineer in addition to a photographer and moving large files around is common. My office is limited to a 2-3 meg internet upload speed until I finally get fiber in a few months.But when I turned it around and read from the card to a file on my computer, it was at least the rated speed, faster in fact. The 2.5 gig test file loaded from the Amazon flash drive onto a very fast M.2 drive  in a around 3 seconds. That's unbelievably fast, I'd have to duplicate it a couple of more times before I could accept that. In any case, the Amazon thumb drive reads very fast. But 10 meg/sec into the thumb drive sucks.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t work with my Onn Google TV.
reviewDescription: I purchased this USB thumb drive to give more storage space to my Onn Google TV device.  I must say it seemed to work at first (even though I was never able to migrate my apps to it) but about a week later it stopped working with the Onn device.  The Onn Google TV device recognizes it is there but cannot make use of its storage space.  It can’t even read the amount of space available on the usb drive.  The Onn device only shows the statement “General USB Drive is safely ejected” every time it is installed and the device is rebooted.  So I have resorted to formatting it and using it with my laptop.  I’m disappointed I can’t use it for the purpose for with it was purchased, but it still has a use.

This USB flash is good for volume storage (although some here are upset about claimed vs actual), but I found the speed pauses or oscillates too much when moving a large folder. I was using a USB 3.2 type A port (blue inner bar of the opening).  The USB 3.0 Flash Drive or card reader will work at the speed of the port, for example if you use a USB 3.0 Flash Drive in your USB 2.0 laptop, it will work at USB 2.0 speed.The top thing to consider is that MS Windows gets file info before moving and this takes about the same amount of time for each one; thus the drive is engaged in a bunch of small non-sequential reads, which are relatively slow. This image shows the progress in moving a larger file from an internal NVMe drive. It starts out fast and one tends to think "it won't take long," than it throttles down on copying the file.  Imagine carrying 300 books from one room to another INDIVIDUALLY vs carrying those 300 books in boxes with 30 books each. The boxes will be much faster.CrystalDiskMark (CDM) is a free and easy-to-use storage benchmarking tool that some have posted here. Most reviews show a < 400mb/s, so how do you interpret? In terms of ranking, this is in the bottom 20% of speed across competing flash drives, but the faster ones (700-1000 mb/s) are going to be more expensive.If you want a cheap USB flash drive, you are going to wait longer to get larger amounts of data over the connection. If speed is important, spend more!

reviewTitle: May have to Reformat the File System
reviewDescription: While the large storage space is useful, this drive's file system will not let you transfer files over 4 GB without reformatting from exFAT to NTFS.  It is a simple process to reformat but disappointing that the drive still runs on a less useful system.  If you are trying to transfer files to the drive that are over 4 GB and you receive an error message saying the drive does not have enough storage, simply reformat the drive's file system.Speed is very good, and storage (128 GB) is more than enough.
Had to format to actually be able to use all 128GB. Already had stuff on here, took like 10 minutes removing and copying back my files.

reviewTitle: Had to reformat to copy files from laptop
reviewDescription: My (very standard) laptop uses the NTFS file system format and this drive is only formatted to FAT file format so wouldn't accept all the file components of files I wanted to copy from my laptop without reformatting.I had to look up how to do it and it wasn't difficult, but in the confusion with several drives open, I reformatted the wrong flash drive and lost a large group of irreplaceable files.  If this would have been correctly formatted that wouldn't have happened.
Very fast however I took two stars because the description of 128gb is a lie
Advertised as fast loading, however it too 2 days to load pictures from iPhoto to the drive.  Would not recommend this product.

reviewTitle: This is a SLOW flash drive.
reviewDescription: I bought this to run Linux ubuntu off of... Did not realize it was the 30mbs max write speed.It runs like a snail.  I had to get a Kingston stick for $10 more, its write speed is 1050mbs max, and has enough speed to run Linux... Just wish I didn't waste so many hours installing it just to realize it's to slow to be of use.  Oh well, if you just want to store basic documents on it, then it's great.
Handy but extremely slow data transfer rate.

I transferred all my data from another flash drive to this.  I checked to be sure all the files were on the drive before I ejected it.  I ejected it to add a label and plugged it back in and my computer could not find it.  I tried multiple slots and computers to no avail.  I took it to a computer repair center and after paying for analysis, they told me that the disc in the flash drive was broken and to retrieve my data I would have to send it out for forensic data retrieval which could be very costly.  In all my years of dealing with flash drives, this has NEVER happened to me and this was right out of the box.  This item is trash and has cost me ALOT of money.  DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID IN PURCHASING THIS ITEM.

reviewTitle: Randomly connects and disconnects, corrupts data
reviewDescription: I got one in 128GB capacity to use for backing up photos and documents. The drive is plugged into a USB 3.0 port. The transfer speeds were in line with the specs. However, the drive appears to randomly disconnect and reconnect during copying process. After each copy I also ran a compare and discovered that out of about 4000 files copied, about 100 were corrupted (didn't compare identically to original). Some of the corrupted files were plain text and I could clearly see the garbage characters.I used tons of flash drives over the years and this is the first time ever I saw data corruption on a brand new USB sticks out of the gate.To make sure this wasn't a problem with the host computer, I reran the copy on a different one - corrupted again. I also did the same copy onto an old SanDisk USB stick I had laying around - no problems.As with all Amazon Basics products, the manufacturing origin is obscured, and I didn't feel like prying them open just to find out. It is possible I got a bad sample, but flash memory or USB controllers are not exactly a bleeding edge of technology anymore and the expectation is that they just work, without a fail.

reviewTitle: Fast - SOMETIMES FOR A WHILE THEN PFFT GONE
reviewDescription: Arrived, plugged into my USB 3 hub where my USB HD is, which is reliable but has a startuo delay after idle. I need FAST response as I DJ for s streaming station and SAN Bradcaster does NOT like loading waits, it can cause an audio hiccup during broadcast - yecch.Crystal Diskmark 8 showed avg. 260MB/s read, more than enough.. BUT..Started copying my 100GB broadcast library to the device.. decent burst performance so was modestly happy.AND THEN THE ERRORS BEGAN.Files refused to copy. Retries failed.  Then the damn new drive WENT OFFLINE, with a nice 'media not ready' error. Just.. vanished.Had to unplug/replug it to get it working.Also refused to format as NTFS. Yaay.Drive repeatedly scanned with zero errors detected, so, what the heck?Copying a small set of directories at a time seemed to work. At least so far.  Who knows when this unreliable junk will fail next?NOT RECOMMENDED FOR TASKS REQUIRING RELIABILITY. My guess is very poor drive firmware as I didn't see a single actual media write or read error.I see why it was so cheap, last time I buy a Basics product. Waste of my money.

reviewTitle: UPDATE: Didn’t work. Software would not load.
reviewDescription: Update: called Amazon customer service and reached a very helpful representative. She accepted the items back for return and sent me a QR code. However, the return amount was 20% less than what I paid. I understand that the return policy says only 80% refund for returns past the date, but I feel if the item was defective and not useable then a full refund should be made especially since it was an Amazon Basics photo stick.Took this on a trip to Europe but didn’t try it out until I was there. Software would not load and very brief instructions with the drives. Tried both and neither worked. I am very disappointed that I missed the return window as I arrived back in country after the deadline.

Update: BAD, BAD, BAD. The Amazon Basics 256GB key won't mount 80% of the time. To make matters worse, it has always been very slow, so 10's of minutes can be wasted while figuring out if it's just the "normal" slower than any other key I've ever purchased or if it isn't going to mount.Original review: I successfully use other brands of USB drives on my TV all the time. This Amazon Basics 256GB drive is SOOOOO slow to come up, I can put away a full load of dishes from the dishwasher and it still may not be up! Even more annoying, no activity light, so I don't know if it's even doing anything (while I'm waiting for it to come up). It eventually does come up. When there was only a few gig of content, it came up a little faster, but still slowest of them all. It's not even a quarter full now.

I tried to add another 4gb, said it was full.So advertised at 128GB, yet only 60GB can be used out of 116Gb that actually show on the item.

reviewTitle: Reports a larger size than actual capacity.
reviewDescription: I bought the 128 GB version of this USB drive, but the drive would not accept even 8 GB.  Windows clearly sees the drive as a 128 drive, but I tried to copy 2 files to it, one of 3.7 GB and one of 4.2 GB.  I received repeated errors that the drive did not have capacity for both files.  Even after formatting and using different file systems, the drive clearly doesn't have the reported capacity.I will chalk this up to some kind of defect for the sake of politeness towards Amazon since it is one of their branded products, but this feels quite dishonest and indented to fool customers into thinking they've bought something larger than they actually have.  In short, don't try to save money with these thumb drives.  Just buy a name brand you can trust.

I spent about 1 hour trying every tip to get this drive to run faster with no luck. (switch ports, turn this off, turn this on, etc...)It is very slow , not fast at all. With write speeds of .5mb to 1.4. Bought the name brand card and the same files wrote at 17mb/s.

The advertisement says "up to" 130MB/s read and "up to" 30MB/s write. My practical experience using the drive with two different computers was more like 90 MB/s read and 0.5MB/s write.  The 30% loss in read time is disappointing, but acceptable.  But a 98.5% loss in write time?  That is either defective or false advertising.As I said, I tried this USB drive on two seperate machines with the same result.  Just to confirm there were no outside issues, I tried a different USB drive on the same USB port.  The different USB drive wrote at 25 MB/s.  So, it isn't a problem with the computer or the USB port.  There is definitely something wrong with this USB drive's ability to write at advertised speeds.

reviewTitle: Gran capacidad con una velocidad más baja de lo esperado
reviewDescription: El pedido llegó muy rápido y debidamente protegido, el pendrive de 256 GB se corresponde con las imágenes del anuncio (26.10.2022).Reseña: Capacidad 256 GBContenido: Se presenta en una caja de cartón donde se indica la capacidad, la versión, su origen y la marca. Dentro de la caja tenemos una bandeja de plástico donde esté alojado el pendrive de 256 GB.Es un pendrive con carcasa de plástico de color negro, en la propia carcasa se indica la marca, la capacidad y su número de serie, pero no se indica que sea una memoria 3.1, este dato solo figura en la caja.Este modelo viene de fábrica en “FAT32”, por lo que, si queremos guardar archivos más de 4 GB, es conveniente formatearlo en “NTFS” o “exFAT” (Windows). La capacidad real con la que viene es de 231 GB y no 256 GB (Esto es debido 1 kilobyte son 1024 bytes y no 1000) y debemos aplicar la siguiente fórmula: 0,9313 x GB, es decir qué multiplicando nos quedaría así: 0,9313 x 256 GB = 238,41 GB, pero este pendrive viene con menos GB “231 GB”.En el anuncio se indica que tiene una lectura de 130 MB/s, cosa que cumple perfectamente, pero no está indicado la velocidad de escritura que es lo más relevante, que siendo un Pendrive 3.1 debería superar los 600 MB/s que es el estándar máximo de un USB 3.0. Pero en todas las pruebas que he realizado me ofrece una velocidad de 80 MB/s, en el mejor de los casos, siendo lo normal 60 MB/s. Con los TEST, me pasa exactamente lo mismo.El hardware que tengo emplea puertos USB 3.2 (MSI X570 CREATION + Ryzen 9 3900X + 32 GB RAM), por lo que no es problema de mi hardware, además tengo otros pendrives que siendo 3.0 superan la velocidad de escritura de este modelo de pendrive en su versión 3.1 (Empleado S.O Windows 11).Características:Marca: Amazon BasicsOrigen: TAIWÁNASIN: B0B61DGG18Color: NegroMaterial: PlásticoTipo: USB Tipo AVersión: 3.1Nombre dispositivo: General USB FlashCapacidad: 256 GB (Real 231 GB)Formato: FAT32 (De fábrica)Velocidad escritura máxima obtenida: - 80 MB/sVelocidad lectura máxima obtenida: + 200 MB/sDimensiones: 56,97 mm de largo x 20,13 mm de ancho x 12,44 mm de grosorPeso: 8,3 gramos (Pendrive)* Es un pendrive USB tipo A de 256 GB (Mucha capacidad), ahora la velocidad de escritura es bastante lenta para ser un pendrive 3.1, ya sean archivos grandes o pequeños.** En el anuncio solo se indica la velocidad de lectura, pero no la de escritura.*** No le doy las 5 estrellas porque es un pendrive bastante lento para ser USB 3.1, ahora por capacidad esta bastante bien de precio (-20€).

reviewTitle: Instantly Loaded and worked , funny business on the capacity. (Full Review Pending More Testing)
reviewDescription: Intitial Reveiw 1/23/2024Overall ***Storage Capacity ***Easy to Use *****Value for Money *****I will write a more thorough review later. I will do about 20 to 100 hours of testing on these drives.But right off the bad, I see some funny business with the usable capacity vs the advertised capacity. I highlighted it here. It is usual for A drive to look like it has less capacity than advertised because two different but similar units are used, one called gibibytes and another called gigabytes, but the problem is even accounting for that, the capacity is ever smaller (another possibility is that they included the cache outside the usable space but I don't know about that)A 256 Gigabyte drive will show up as 238.4 GB on a Windows computer. The problem is that these drives show up as only 231.1 GB, over 3% less than expected.

reviewTitle: Pretty good, but not as fast as some are claiming
reviewDescription: It's a pretty good drive and a very good value at about $10 for "128 GB".Some things to note: On my machine this device shows up as a block storage device with 124,623,257,600 bytes, which I might generously round up to 125 GB if I were describing this product... but not 128 GB. This whole rounding up to the nearest power of 2 thing in advertising storage devices is false advertising and it really isn't necessary. Just say what it is... it's a good value without fibbing.Speed: The *Interface* speed is great, sure, but devices like this use a small write cache to hide the fact that the actual flash media is way slower than the interface. If you write a little bit of data, you can rapidly move it to the write cache and the device can claim it finished while slowly finishing the actual write in firmware. If you write a lot of data you will fill the write cache and the transfer will slow down to approximately the speed of the actual flash media. On this device I seem to get about 20.5 MB/s once this happens. This is the speed you should expect if transferring a large amount of data (although lots of tiny files will always be slower so you may see somewhat slower speeds IRL). This isn't too bad for a budget drive, but it's nowhere close to a high-performance thumbdrive or a USB SSD. Just set your expectations accordingly.In summary, this is a descent drive and is pretty fast for a budget drive. A very good value at about $10 / 125 GB.

Despite the slightly lower storage capacity, this flash drive is still a great purchase given its performance and affordable price.

It's a good value for the amount of storage if you already know how to repartition a drive. If you don't know how to or don't want to learn how, just get a 32 GB drive. Also, don't expect this drive to be highspeed. It's still a USB connection, not SATA. Max download speeds are around 4-4.5 MB/s. If you just want to use it for a lot of pictures and/or documents, it's the perfect fit for you. My 2 stars are due to the drive not being partitioned correctly when sent out to customers, and positively, it has a good value for the storage amount if you know how to unlock it.

soprattutto considerando le mie precedenti, fallimentari esperienze con questo genere di orpelli, di varia origine e capacità, finite finora in due dei seguenti modi: rese al mittente (quando possibile) o gettate nel cassonetto tout court, possibilmente prima che potessero fare troppi danni (in un caso, un paio di anni fa, l'ordigno del demonio mi ha fatto piantare irreversibilmente un portatile, chissà che accidenti ci avevano installato dentro!) quando non si sono fucilate motu proprio nel bel mezzo di qualche operazione.Questa almeno non costa uno sproposito, la capacità (nominale) è quella prevista e se non altro non si pianta mentre la usi - cosa tutt'altro che scontata - però tende, anche questa, a rallentare brutalmente dopo pochi minuti e questo nonostante sia tecnicamente una 3.1Per il momento le ho assegnato un punteggio medio, in attesa di ulteriori e più approfondite valutazioni o sviluppi; è comunque già tanto che funzioni decentemente, spero solo continui così.

Clé livrée d'origine en format Fat32 dans une petite boite en carton, il faudra la formater en ntfs pour pouvoir y mettre des fichiers de taille supérieur à 4go, après test de vitesse on se rend compte qu'en écriture on est bridée en moyenne entre 27 et 40 mo/s en écriture réelle sur la clé (fichier de test 20 Go).Pour ce qui est de la lecture on obtiens sur un fichier de approximativement 4Go une moyenne de 122-126mo/s en lecture réelle depuis la clé.La clé est en plastique et ne semble pas très robuste, attention donc à ceux qui on l'habitude de mettre dans les poches arrière des pantalons.Pour ce qui est des vitesses j'ai testé sur un port USB 3.0 ainsi qu'en 3.2. on obtiens des résultat sensiblement différents en test via CrystalDiskMark (voir image jointes):USB 3.0 Lecture ~40mo/s, Écriture ~20mo/sUSB 3.2 Lecture ~134mo/s, Écriture ~58mo/sOn est clairement pas sur la meilleur puce mais pour ce prix la (achat le 10/03/23 au prix de 24€30).On peut pas en demandé de trop non plus elle fait le travaille et c'est surtout pour la capacité  que je l'ai acheter.Niveau durabilité j’espère quelle ne cessera pas de fonctionner dans les prochains mois comme pour certains autres acheteur.

Obwohl alle Ordner über 4 GB auf dem Stick vorhanden sind werden sie in der Summe nicht berücksichtigt. In den Eigenschaften ist die Auslastung identisch. Ich empfehle den Stick nicht zum Kauf.

Das Amazon Basics 128 GB USB 3.1 Flash-Laufwerk startete mit vielversprechenden Spezifikationen und einer hohen Erwartungshaltung meinerseits. Mit einer angegebenen Lesegeschwindigkeit von bis zu 130 Mbit/s und der großzügigen Kapazität von 128 GB schien es ideal für den täglichen Gebrauch, sei es für die Übertragung großer Datenmengen oder als erweiterter Speicher für Multimedia-Dateien. Die USB 3.1 Technologie versprach zudem eine schnelle und effiziente Leistung.Anfängliche Erfahrungen:Performance: In den ersten Tagen funktionierte das Laufwerk tadellos. Dateien wurden schnell geladen und gespeichert, und die hohe Übertragungsgeschwindigkeit wurde deutlich spürbar. Diese Performance machte es zu einem scheinbar hervorragenden Wert für den Preis.Doch dann kamen die Probleme:Zuverlässigkeit: Leider hielt die Freude nicht lange an. Nach nur wenigen Tagen Nutzung erlitt das Flash-Laufwerk einen vollständigen Ausfall. Es wurde plötzlich von keinem meiner Geräte mehr erkannt, und jegliche Versuche, auf die gespeicherten Daten zuzugreifen oder den Stick zu formatieren, schlugen fehl.Datenverlust: Dieser Ausfall führte zum Verlust aller darauf gespeicherten Daten. Für mich als Nutzer, der wichtige Arbeitsdokumente und persönliche Daten auf dem Flash-Laufwerk gespeichert hatte, war dies nicht nur ärgerlich, sondern auch problematisch.Verarbeitungsqualität: Obwohl das Laufwerk äußerlich robust wirkte, legen die internen Komponenten nahe, dass die Verarbeitungsqualität möglicherweise nicht den Standards entspricht, die für eine langfristige und zuverlässige Datenspeicherung erforderlich sind.Fazit:Das Amazon Basics 128 GB USB 3.1 Flash-Laufwerk hat anfänglich durch seine Leistung überzeugt, doch der schnelle und unerwartete Ausfall hat dieses Bild stark getrübt. Dies wirft Fragen bezüglich der Qualitätskontrolle und Zuverlässigkeit der Amazon Basics Speicherprodukte auf. Für potenzielle Käufer würde ich empfehlen, möglicherweise etwas mehr zu investieren in Produkte, die eine höhere Zuverlässigkeit und Kundensupport bieten.Dieser Vorfall hat deutlich gemacht, dass bei der Auswahl von Datenspeicherlösungen nicht nur die Spezifikationen, sondern auch die Langzeit-Zuverlässigkeit und die Erfahrungen anderer Nutzer zu berücksichtigen sind.

Dieser Stick bricht aber alle Negativrekorde: Er schafft es pro Sekunde 2 MB zu übertragen. So langsam war bisher kein Stick. Das Befüllen wird mit 130 GB wird so ca. 18 bis 20 Stunden dauern. Das kenne ich nur von billigsten USB Sticks.Ich habe mittlerweile auch mehrere Dateisysteme und Clustergrößen probiert: FAT32, exFAT, NTFS, ...  keine große Auswirkung. Der Stick bleibt langsam.

Unterschiedliche USB Anschlüsse, bei denen meine anderen USB3 Sticks zwischen 30-80mb/s erreichen,schaft dieser Amazon USB3 Stick nur zwischen 1-4mb/s.Ob kleine oder sehr große Dateien, Fat32, exfat oder NTFS formatiert, der Stick versagt auf ganzer Länge.Zum Glück ist er kein Fake, es passen wirklich über 240GB drauf.....

Edit: 5 months in and the drive is dead. Ignore the Chat-GPT positive reviews (all of them have the exact same type of writing, you'll notice), this is not really usable at all. There's also zero warranty so there's no recourse when the drive does fail. Get a name brand product with warranty instead.Very poor write performance. Good capacity for the price. Read speed is good - 75-85 MB/s through the entire drive.Decent if you can live very low write speed, thus archive-based use. I see nothing more than 32 MB/s, often lower. There is no cache (software or hardware), so the write speed is extra slow with no short-term bursts possible.I was expecting better performance than the low-cost Sandisk 256GB drive I was using, but it's a little worse overall, in both write and read performance.Unlike most other drives, the large form factor means the extender mechanism should work well even if the latches wear down. No lanyard is included, even though the drive allows for one. I'd say with caveats, it is usable.

RWseq+4k: 140/40/15/4. That's pretty nice for a throwaway thumbdrive. Can't care less about read speed as what i'm always waiting for is writing completion. I care very much about 4K write speed too - that's what massively slows down Linux installations. So it's better than usual <1MBs. A  nice bump. reviewTitle: Fast & generous sized USB 3 drive for the price!
reviewDescription: All positives on this USB drive, simply took a gamble on the Amazon Basics name after receiving an invitation to buy on promo recently. Not only is it Huge, also fast transfer times on a USB 3.0 connection compared to every one I have, to include a pair of Lexar ones of the same size (& more costly at around $30) purchased at Costco 4-5 years back. Of course, these components typically gets better over time, can recall a pair of 4GB SanDisk ones costing near the same (each).A lot of computer users, myself included, could backup our Windows or "C" partition with this size of a USB drive. As long as the backup program allows. Or can store lots of digital pics & movies, although I prefer to store these on traditional hard drives, the spinning ones. They'll last longer on magnetic versus Flash media. This is Not because of a defect in Flash (cell) type media, rather if sitting unused for a long time (from 2-5+ years), any copies made won't look as good as when taken. Don't store near hot places, like close to a computer.Will be buying more of these in the near future! One more use of this is to have a portable, Secure operating system in your pocket, like Windows to Go or a Linux based one, such as Linux Mint or Ubuntu, among others. There are guides on how to do this, but most important, unplug the main drive on your computer while creating this. Otherwise, can mess the bootloader of your Windows computer up. Just unplug the SATA cable (the narrow one) to your existing drive or remove the drive if NVMe or mSATA. At it's 128GB size, perfect for secrecy!Bottom line, if I could give this drive 10 Stars, I would, and by the time it's said & done, will have 5-6 of these for my purposes (storage & secret OS's). Also has the Amazon Basics warranty. So be sure to test when purchased.EDIT: This drive has been so fast & dependable that I also purchased the 256GB model for $5-6 more!

reviewTitle: Meets advertised specs for speed and capacity.  Good price, fast delivery.
reviewDescription: Ordered a 128GB flash drive and that's what I received.  This is worth mentioning, because the marketplace is awash with fake flash drives whose actual capacity is far less than what's claimed.  (It isn't hard to buy a cheap "128GB" drive that's actually a 32GB drive with firmware hacked to claim a much larger capacity.)  But this drive is the real deal.  I loaded it with 127+ GB of test data and then verified that *all* the data was present on the drive.Write speed averaged 12MB/sec over the entire time of filling the drive.  Short-term burst write speeds hit about 40MB/sec.  Read speed was a fairly constant 70MB/sec.Can't say much about longevity, but for the week that I've owned it, it's been doing everything it promises.
